title: IsoHemp
description: Major industrial hempcrete block manufacturer producing over 5 million blocks annually. Distribution across Europe and North America.

title: UK Hempcrete
description: Market-leading UK hempcrete and bio-based building materials supplier. Material supply, consultancy, and training throughout the UK.

title: Hempitecture
description: US hemp hurd and hempcrete materials supplier. Nationwide distribution. Works with hemp fiber growers and processors.

title: Hemp and Block
description: First American hempcrete block company. Pre-cast hemp-lime blocks and hempcrete binder. Made in USA.

title: HempStone Construction & Supply
description: Hempcrete supply and construction. Partners with hemp fiber growers and processors in Eastern North America.

title: Americhanvre LLC
description: Full-service hempcrete installer for retrofits and new construction across the USA.

title: IsoHemp France
description: Branch office of IsoHemp serving the French hempcrete market. Opened 2022.

title: La Chanvrière
description: Oldest hemp processor in France (est. 1973). Largest hemp processor in the world by volume.

title: Eurochanvre
description: Hemp processor since 1994 in Franche-Comté. Specializes in construction materials.

title: CAVAC Biomatériaux
description: Hemp and straw processor. Only European factory with two-stage hurd/fiber separation process.

title: Agro Chanvre
description: Hemp processor since 2008 in Normandy. Building materials and organic food.

title: Hemp Block USA
description: Interlocking load-bearing hempcrete block system. Supply across North America and Canada.

title: US Hemp Hurd
description: American-grown hemp hurd and fiber for hempcrete and building applications.

title: Ightham Mote Visitor Centre
description: 317m² visitor reception for National Trust medieval manor. Completed 2024. Timber frame with hempcrete infill and lime render. Carbon-negative.

title: Flat House (Margent Farm)
description: Prototype low-embodied-carbon home with pre-fabricated hempcrete panels. Zero-carbon off-grid design. Built in 2 days. Research facility.

title: House Made by Many Hands
description: Victorian extension with hand-poured hempcrete walls. Built communally by architects and homeowners. Won Environmental Leadership Prize 2024.

title: Derbyshire Hempcrete House
description: 230m² 3-storey family home. 400mm monolithic hempcrete walls. Completed 2021. Maintains 18°C+ internally with minimal heating.

title: The Triangle
description: 42-home housing development (2011). Timber-frame with hempcrete external walls and lime render. Code 4 sustainable homes.

title: Pierre Chevet Sports Hall
description: First public building in France built from hempcrete (380m²). Dry-assembled interlocking blocks. Hemp grown and fabricated within 500km.

title: Case di Luce
description: Largest hemp-lime housing project in Europe. Two multi-storey buildings with 61 flats (energy class A+). Won Casaclima Awards 2017.

title: Van Laethem Garden Studio
description: Small garden studio with 40cm hemp walls and cedar shingles. Connected to main home's rainwater/solar systems.

title: Voice of Urban Nature Pavilion
description: Demountable pavilion at Floriade 2022. 100% biobased with hemp-lime fill in black timber modules. Fully biodegradable.

title: Iceland First Hempcrete Building
description: First hempcrete building in Iceland. Completed 2020. Japanese tea house inspired design with local hemp and lime.

title: Hondo Texas Hempcrete House
description: 2375 sq ft hempcrete house. First prize US Hemp Building Association 2023-2024 contest. Built by Texas Healthy Homes.

title: Openly Valley Widnau
description: Europe's largest hemp building. Clay and lime plaster walls and floors. Saved ~900 tonnes CO₂ vs conventional build.

title: BaleHaus@Bath
description: Two-storey straw bale research building on University of Bath campus. ModCell prefabricated panels. Scientifically monitored for thermal and structural performance.

title: Marfa Ranch House
description: Rammed earth ranch house by Lake Flato Architects. 3 million pounds of rammed earth. 2-foot-thick walls in Chihuahuan Desert.

title: Greater World Earthship Community
description: 600+ acre off-grid community. ~200 earthship homes. Tire-rammed walls, passive solar, recycled water. Educational facility training 200+ students/year.

title: Earthaven Ecovillage
description: 329-acre intentional community (est. 1994). Multiple natural building structures: timber straw-bale, cob, straw-clay. Natural Building School on site.

title: Zaytuna Farm (PRI)
description: 66-hectare educational permaculture farm. First straw bale building in Australia (1993). Straw bale/bamboo bale housing with mud-lime plaster.

title: Cob Cottage Company
description: Research and education in natural building. 12+ cob demonstration cottages on site. 9-day intensive workshops in cob construction. Monthly public tours.

title: School of Natural Building (SNaB)
description: UK-based natural building training integrated with active build projects. Hempcrete, straw bale, cob. Hands-on and theoretical.

title: Edwards Cob Building Services
description: Original UK cob training provider (est. 2005, 18+ years). 70+ schools served. Cob courses and pizza oven workshops.

title: The Year of Mud
description: Family-friendly natural building workshops in Appalachian foothills. Lodging and meals included. Cob, straw bale, earthen plaster.

title: Finger Lakes School of Natural Building
description: Workshops in Ithaca/Trumansburg area. Strawbale wall construction and log cabin saunas.

title: Cob Hill Natural Building School
description: 50-acre facility in Piney Woods. Natural building school with Cob for Vets program.

title: Mud Dauber School
description: Natural building workshops since 2014. Cob, straw bale, natural plaster. Community demonstration projects.

title: Wild Abundance Natural Building
description: Natural building workshops near Asheville. Hands-on classes using demonstration projects as teaching laboratories.

title: Yestermorrow Design/Build School
description: Natural Building Certificate program. Multi-week immersive. Strawbale, cob, clay/lime plasters, earthen floors.

title: Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage
description: Intentional ecovillage (est. 1997) offering natural building workshops in rolling hills setting.

title: Cob Workshops (Hempcrete/Cob)
description: Hempcrete workshops in Oregon and Washington. Cob workshops in Tennessee.

title: Community Rebuilds
description: Workshop and course program focused on community-based natural building education.

title: University of Bath — Hemp Research
description: Centre for Innovative Construction Materials. HIVE facility testing hemp-lime panels. 36-month EU programme with monitoring in UK, Spain, France.

title: Healthy Materials Lab (Parsons)
description: Research on hemp-lime in affordable housing. Master of Architecture hempcrete projects. Indoor air quality monitoring.

title: Aberystwyth University — Hemp Hub
description: Industrial Hemp Innovations Hub at AberInnovation Campus. Hemp construction materials, textiles, biofuels, food and medical applications.

title: University of Aberdeen — Hemp Research
description: Hemp research programme since 2012 funded by Scottish Government. High-protein food crop and industrial applications.

title: University of York — HEMP-30
description: HEMP-30 project at Biorenewables Development Centre. Aims to increase UK hemp cultivation from 800 to 80,000 hectares.

title: International Hemp Building Association
description: Non-profit promoting hemp-based construction globally. Company members directory. Supports sustainable bio-regional development.

title: European Industrial Hemp Association (EIHA)
description: Pan-European membership org for industrial hemp (est. 2005). 200+ members across 25 EU states. Covers construction, textiles, cosmetics, food.

title: British Hemp Alliance
description: UK industry organisation for hemp sector interests including building, agriculture, and policy.

title: Alliance for Sustainable Building Products
description: UK organisation listing hemp building product members and suppliers. Promotes sustainable building products.

title: California Straw Building Association (CASBA)
description: Non-profit advancing straw building research, testing, documentation. Worked on hundreds of straw bale structures across diverse climates and seismic zones.

title: Australasian Straw Bale Building Association (Ausbale)
description: Non-profit (est. 2002). Develops information on straw bale techniques and performance. 30+ years industry experience.

title: Natural Building Australia
description: Directory and advocacy for natural building in Australia. Promotes hempcrete, straw bale, and bio-based materials.

title: Earthship Biotecture
description: Organization promoting earthship design and off-grid living. Founded by Mike Reynolds. Educational center training 200+ students/year.

title: HempFlax
description: Pioneer hemp processor (est. 1993). Largest EU hemp processor by volume. Supplies hemp shives + ISO Hemp Blocks for hempcrete construction. Continuous factory expansion.

title: Just BioFiber
description: Interlocking hempcrete block system — Lego-style stacking into timber frame. 2-hour fire rating. 6.5 kg CO₂ sequestered per block. Licensing model for regional manufacturing.

title: Renewabuild
description: Licensed manufacturer of Just BioFiber interlocking hempcrete blocks. 2 blocks/minute production. Factory expansion underway.

title: Lancaster Lime Works
description: US hemp block manufacturer using lime-only binder (no Portland cement). Blocks + binders + hemp shiv available direct. R-value ~2.4/inch. Local pickup and shipping.

title: DTE Materials
description: Stonefiber™ hemp aggregate blocks — ASTM C90 rated (600-2000 psi). Replaces CMU with carbon-neutral bio-aggregate from hemp and agricultural waste. Working with major builders on scale.

title: 8th Fire Innovations (DiVita Hemp Blocks)
description: Hemp blocks designed to retrofit into 2x4/2x6 conventional framing (16\ on center). Interlocking system. 100% local materials goal. Affiliate network across North America."

title: Cânhamor
description: ECOblocks™ made from hemp shavings, lime and clay. Carbon-negative. 123+ houses built in Portugal. ~300 houses/month capacity. Largest hemp factory in world (expanding).

title: Fibonacci LLC (HempWood)
description: First commercial pressed hemp lumber company. HempWood® 20% harder than hickory. Dimensional boards, flooring, turning blanks. Non-structural interior applications. Working toward structural ratings.

title: Plantd Materials
description: Ex-SpaceX founders making hemp-based OSB and structural panels. Carbon-negative: sequesters 80 lbs CO₂ per 4x8 sheet. $22M raised. Structural timber prototype in development.

title: Boardwurks Biocomposites
description: HempBOARD panels and hemp hybrid composites. Zero formaldehyde. Superior moisture resistance. Hemp-sugarcane and hemp-wheat bran product lines.
